title: In seven years, HVDC market size is going to be $12-15 billion: GE Vernova
description: India needs to progress in procurement. It must review its procurement process, says Bindele
content:
Renewable-energy projects are being delayed not because of equipment but owing to factors like getting land, say Johan Bindele, head of grid integration and AC systems at GE’s grid solutions, and Sandeep Zanzaria, chief executive officer, GE Vernova, India, in an interview with S Dinakar. Edited excerpts.

Where does India stand in your global transmission portfolio?

summary: Inventive-related issues are not due to equipment delays, but due to factors such as obtaining land. The head of grid integration and AC systems at GE's grid solutions and CEO, Sandeep Zanzaria, suggest that India is among the top five countries in the world for the electrification market, alongside the United States, some European countries.
argos_summary: GE Vernova projects the global HVDC market will reach $12‑15 billion in seven years. In India, the company ranks among its top five markets, yet renewable projects are delayed by land acquisition and procurement inefficiencies. GE stresses that India must streamline procurement to accelerate grid integration.
